trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when the user cancels an operation during the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.CardSpaceSelector.GetToken(System.IdentityModel.Selectors.CardSpacePolicyElement[],System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer)"></xref> call.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.UserCancellationException"></xref> class.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.UserCancellationException"></xref> class with the specified error message.

This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error and takes into account the current system culture.
The message that describes the error.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.UserCancellationException"></xref> class with serialized data.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that contains the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> object that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.UserCancellationException"></xref> class with the specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The message that describes the error.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.
